numlitem.para: Associated start valve light is operative, and
Manual override start procedures are used.

note.para: If the L/R start valve NOT OPEN/NOT CLOSED position switches failed open, it is possible to get "L/R HYD SYS PRESS" EICAS message/light and "Rudder Ratio" EICAS message/light to illuminate during the engine start cycle.

numlitem.para: Perform normal engine start procedure except:
When start switch for engine with inoperative start valve is placed in ground start position, instruct ground crewman to open start control valve.
When 50% N2 RPM - P&W (47% N3 RPM - RB211) is attained, instruct ground crewman to close start control valve and observe that engine start switch has returned to AUTO.
If an inflight start becomes necessary, ensure airspeed is sufficient for a windmill start (see AOM speed requirements).

placard.para: Placard affected Start Switch on overhead panel "START VALVE INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: If the L/R start valve NOT OPEN/NOT CLOSED position switches failed open, it is possible to get "L/R HYD SYS PRESS" EICAS message/light and "Rudder Ratio" EICAS message/light to illuminate during the engine start cycle.

numlitem.para: Establish interphone communication between personnel on ramp and in flight compartment.

caution.para: DO NOT USE SHORTER EXTENSIONS TO MAKE UP THE 18-INCH EXTENSION. DAMAGE TO ENGINE COULD RESULT.

note.para: Core cowl panels should remain closed.

numlitem.para: Insert 3/8-inch square drive with 18-inch extension through access port in core cowl and engage drive into valve override 3/8-inch internal receptacle.
Upon command from flight compartment, rotate the 3/8-inch drive counterclockwise to open valve.
Upon command from flight compartment, rotate drive clockwise promptly to close valve.

In the event of an electrical failure of the start valve solenoid, the valve may be opened by pushing the manual override knob to unseat the ball valve, thus admitting air to the larger piston while simultaneously closing the vent. If the manual override knob fails to open the start valve, it can be opened by turning the manual override shaft with a 1/2 inch deep socket wrench.
Open access door in left fan cowl to gain access to starter control valve (see illustration).
Establish interphone communication between personnel on ramp and in flight compartment.
Upon command from the flight deck, push and hold manual override knob or shaft.
Upon command from the flight deck, release manual override knob or shaft promptly.
